Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: 工場長
Entry.EnglishText: Manager

Entry.JapaneseText: 男の人
Entry.EnglishText: Man

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: セレーナ
Entry.EnglishText: Serena

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 製鉄工場
Entry.EnglishText: Iron Factory

Entry.JapaneseText: 製鉄工場
Entry.EnglishText: Iron Factory

Entry.JapaneseText: こら！ 誰が休んでいいと 言った！ 働け!!
Entry.EnglishText: Hey! Who said you could take a break?! Get back to work!

Entry.JapaneseText: ひぃっ……!!
Entry.EnglishText: Agh...!

Entry.JapaneseText: なにやってんだ、工場長!?
Entry.EnglishText: Boss, what are you doing?!

Entry.JapaneseText: おお、<Tytree>。 見てのとおり、怠け者のガジュマを 罰しておったところだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Ah, <Tytree>. I'm punishing this lazy Gajuma, as you can see.

Entry.JapaneseText: そういう事じゃなくて！ ムチ打って<Yellow>ヒト<White>を働かせるなんて、 いいと思ってんのかよ！
Entry.EnglishText: That's not what I meant! You seriously think it's okay to force a <Yellow>Human<White> being to work by whipping them?!

Entry.JapaneseText: 突然、何を言い出すんだね。 私たちはガジュマに労働の場を 与えてやっているんだろう？
Entry.EnglishText: What's gotten into you all of a sudden? Aren't we supposed to be putting these Gajuma to work?
Eh???

Entry.JapaneseText: こいつら、身体だけは 丈夫にできているからな。
Entry.EnglishText: Bodily strength is about the only thing they have going for them, after all.

Entry.JapaneseText: 知性の低いガジュマの連中には 我らヒューマのため、しっかりと 働いて、社会に貢献してもらわんと。
Entry.EnglishText: We have to make these intellectually challenged Gajuma work hard for us Huma so that they can contribute to society.

Entry.JapaneseText: 工場長の言うとおりよ。 ヒューマは頭を使い、 ガジュマは身体を使う。 当然の事じゃないの。
Entry.EnglishText: It is as he says. Huma use their brains, and Gajuma use their brawn. It's the natural order of things.

Entry.JapaneseText: 本気で言ってんのかよ、姉貴!! これは差別じゃないか!!
Entry.EnglishText: You can't be serious, sis! That's discriminatory!

Entry.JapaneseText: これは差別じゃない、区別よ。 動物と<Yellow>ヒト<White>が違うように、 ヒューマとガジュマにも 住み分けが必要なの。
Entry.EnglishText: No, it's differentiation. Just as animals are different from <Yellow>Humans<White>, Gajuma need to be considered separate from Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: やめてくれ、姉貴!! いつからそんなふうに なっちまったんだ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Cut it out, sis! Since when did you think like that?!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマとガジュマは 同じ<Yellow>ヒト<White>じゃないか!!
Entry.EnglishText: Huma or Gajuma, we're all <Yellow>Human<White> beings, aren't we?

Entry.JapaneseText: 本気でそんな事を言ってるの？ 本当に同じなの……？
Entry.EnglishText: Do you really believe the words coming out of your mouth? Do you really think that they are the same...?

Entry.JapaneseText: また、おれは……
Entry.EnglishText: Here again...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……工場長！ やめてくれ！
Entry.EnglishText: ...Stop it, Boss!

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしてこんな事するんだよ!! 俺たちはこの工場のためを思って、 効率のいい作業のやり方を 提案しただけじゃないか!!
Entry.EnglishText: Why are you doing this!? We were only suggesting a way to make our work more efficient for the benefit of the factory!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマは余計な事を しなくていいのだよ。 我々ヒューマ以上の考えなど ガジュマに出るはずがない。
Entry.EnglishText: Gajuma have no business proposing anything. You couldn't possibly come up with a better idea than a Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: 俺たちガジュマだって ヒューマと同じように考えたり 何かを作ったりする事はできる!!
Entry.EnglishText: We Gajuma are just as capable of thinking and creating things as Huma are!

Entry.JapaneseText: それがムダだと言うのだ。 そんな事に意味はない。 黙って働いておればよい！
Entry.EnglishText: You're wasting your breath spouting off that nonsense. Now, shut up and get back to work!

Entry.JapaneseText: それとも私たちの言葉の意味まで わからなくなったのかしら？ だったら、叩いて教え込むしか ないわね。おやりなさい！
Entry.EnglishText: Perhaps they no longer understand what we're saying? If that's the case, then giving them a beating is the only way we can hammer it into them. Give them what's coming!

Entry.JapaneseText: やめろ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Stop!

Entry.JapaneseText: 何をするの、<Tytree>!!
Entry.EnglishText: What are you doing, <Tytree>?!

Entry.JapaneseText: 姉貴も、工場長も間違ってる!! おれたちは同じ街に住む仲間じゃないか。 どうして、こんなひどい事が できるんだよ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Sis, Boss, you're both wrong! How can you justify doing these terrible things when we all live together in this town! We're neighbors!

Entry.JapaneseText: あなただってわかってるはずよ。 ヒューマとガジュマが同じじゃないって。 それを認めようとしないだけでしょ。 キレイごとを言わないで!!
Entry.EnglishText: You should know why. It's because Huma and Gajuma are different, yet you can't bring yourself to admit that. Stop trying to sugarcoat it!

Entry.JapaneseText: キレイごとなんかじゃない!! おれは本気でそう思ってるんだ!! こんなやり方は……こんな差別は おれがブチ壊してやる!!
Entry.EnglishText: I'm not sugarcoating anything! It's what I truly believe! This system... All this discrimination... I'm going to tear it all down!

Entry.JapaneseText: うおぉぉぉぉぉぉぉッ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Uooohh!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>…… おまえ、自分が何をしているのか わかっているのか……？
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>! Do you have any idea what you're doing...?

Entry.JapaneseText: <scale:180>うるせぇ!!<scale:100>
Entry.EnglishText: <scale:180>SHUT UP!

Entry.JapaneseText: 助かった……
Entry.EnglishText: You helped us...

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたたちはもう自由だ。 早くここから逃げろ。
Entry.EnglishText: You're free now. Hurry up and get out of here.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ああ、そうするさ。 ありがとうよ……
Entry.EnglishText: Right, we will. Thanks...

Entry.JapaneseText: 工場長……あんたの言うとおりさ！ ガジュマとヒューマは違う！ それを、思い知らせてやるぜ!! 楽しみにしてな!!
Entry.EnglishText: Boss... you're right! Gajuma and Huma are different, and we'll make sure that you understand that. You'd better watch your back!

Entry.JapaneseText: おい……ちょっと待て！ 何を……どういう事だ!?
Entry.EnglishText: Hey... Hold on! What are you... What are you talking about?!

Entry.JapaneseText: 新入りの野郎、昨日から サボってやがるんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: The new guy, he's been slacking off since yesterday.

Entry.JapaneseText: 設計士のガップラもおとといから 工場にきてないしよ…… まったく、困ったもんだぜ。
Entry.EnglishText: Gapra, the architect, hasn't been to the factory since the day before yesterday... Man, we're in a real pickle.

Entry.JapaneseText: 変わった事かい？ そりゃあ、新人の野郎だよ。
Entry.EnglishText: What's changed since then? Well, just the new guy we hired.

Entry.JapaneseText: 怖くて仕事ができないとか わけのわからん理由で 仕事をサボリやがって……
Entry.EnglishText: Too scared to work or skipping work for some inexplicable reason.

Entry.JapaneseText: 新人の野郎、わけのわからん理由で 仕事をサボリやがって……
Entry.EnglishText: The new guy's skipping work for some inexplicable reason...

Entry.JapaneseText: 新人の野郎、わけのわからん理由で 仕事をサボリやがって……
Entry.EnglishText: The new guy's skipping work for some inexplicable reason...

Entry.JapaneseText: あのくぼみは工場を修理する時に、 設計士のガップラってヤツが、 どうしてもって、作らせたんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: When the factory was being repaired, the architect Gapra insisted on making those weird hole-looking indentations in the wall.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガップラさんが、 くぼみを作らせた理由は わかりませんか？
Entry.EnglishText: Do you have any idea why Gapra had the indentations made?

Entry.JapaneseText: さあな……本人に直接聞ければ 一発なんだけど、おとといくらいから 行方知れずなんだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I have no idea... If I could just ask him directly, I'd have a clearer answer, but he's been missing since about the day before yesterday.

Entry.JapaneseText: このくぼみは ガップラが作らせたと言うが、 一体何のために……
Entry.EnglishText: They say this hollow space was made by Gapra, but for what purpose?

Entry.JapaneseText: それを尋ねようにも、 おとといからガップラさんの姿を 見かけないって言いますし……
Entry.EnglishText: I tried to ask that person over there about it, but he said he hadn't seen Gapra since the day before yesterday.

Entry.JapaneseText: すすり泣きが聞こえ始めたのも おとといだったよな……
Entry.EnglishText: It was only the day before yesterday that they started to hear the sobbing...

Entry.JapaneseText: と、とにかく！ あのくぼみのことが気になりますね。 他の人にも聞いてみませんか？
Entry.EnglishText: A-Anyway! I'm curious about that hole. Why don't you ask the others?

Entry.JapaneseText: そうだな。
Entry.EnglishText: Sounds good.

Entry.JapaneseText: くぼみのことが知りたいんなら 他のヤツに聞いてみるんだな。
Entry.EnglishText: If you want to know about that space in the wall, you'll have to ask the other guys.

Entry.JapaneseText: 新入りの野郎、昨日から サボってやがるんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: The new guy, he's been slacking off since yesterday.

Entry.JapaneseText: 設計士のガップラもおとといから 工場にきてないしよ…… まったく、困ったもんだぜ。
Entry.EnglishText: Gapra, the architect, hasn't been to the factory since the day before yesterday... Man, we're in a real pickle.

Entry.JapaneseText: ゴタゴタもかたづいたことだし、 まじめに働くとするか！
Entry.EnglishText: Now that the mess is over, let's get back to work!

Entry.JapaneseText: 新入りの野郎、昨日から サボってやがるんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: The new guy, he's been slacking off since yesterday.

Entry.JapaneseText: 設計士のガップラもおとといから 工場にきてないしよ…… まったく、困ったもんだぜ。
Entry.EnglishText: Gapra, the architect, hasn't been to the factory since the day before yesterday... Man, we're in a real pickle.

Entry.JapaneseText: やっぱり体を動かして まじめに働くのが一番だぜ！
Entry.EnglishText: After all, it's best to be physically active and work diligently!
Entry.Notes: After all at the end maybe?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: 柵が閉まっている……
Entry.EnglishText: The fence is shut closed.

Entry.JapaneseText: 柵が閉まってるよ。
Entry.EnglishText: The fence is shut closed.

Entry.JapaneseText: 鉄柵が閉まっているな。
Entry.EnglishText: The steel fence is closed.

Entry.JapaneseText: 鉄の柵が閉まってますね。
Entry.EnglishText: The steel fence is closed.

Entry.JapaneseText: 鉄の柵が閉まっているな。
Entry.EnglishText: The steel fence is closed.

Entry.JapaneseText: 鉄の柵が閉まっているわ。
Entry.EnglishText: The steel fence is closed.

Entry.JapaneseText: 鉄の柵が閉まっているわ……
Entry.EnglishText: The steel fence is closed.

Entry.JapaneseText: 鉄の柵が閉まっている。
Entry.EnglishText: The steel fence is closed.

Entry.JapaneseText: この壁のくぼみは……
Entry.EnglishText: This hollow space in the wall is...

Entry.JapaneseText: ただの装飾という感じでは なさそうですね。
Entry.EnglishText: It doesn't seem to be just a decoration.

Entry.JapaneseText: 怪しいな……ちょうど何か はめ込めそうな形だぜ。
Entry.EnglishText: Kinda sus... Looks like the kind of shape that you could fit something into.

Entry.JapaneseText: このくぼみは ガップラが作らせたと言うが、 一体何のために……
Entry.EnglishText: They say this hollow space was made by Gapra, but for what purpose?

Entry.JapaneseText: それを尋ねようにも、 おとといからガップラさんの姿を 見かけないって言いますし……
Entry.EnglishText: I tried to ask that person over there about it, but he said he hadn't seen Gapra since the day before yesterday.

Entry.JapaneseText: すすり泣きが聞こえ始めたのも おとといだったよな……
Entry.EnglishText: It was only the day before the last that they started to hear the sobbing...

Entry.JapaneseText: と、とにかく！ あのくぼみのことが気になりますね。 他の人にも聞いてみませんか？
Entry.EnglishText: A-Anyway! I'm curious about that hole. Why don't you ask the others?

Entry.JapaneseText: そうだな。
Entry.EnglishText: Sounds good.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガップラさんが作った壁のくぼみと 同じ形のブローチ……
Entry.EnglishText: A brooch made by Gapra in the same shape as the hollow space in the wall...

Entry.JapaneseText: 製鉄工場の修復とは、全然 関係ない事ばかりだな……
Entry.EnglishText: This has nothing to do with the restoration of the steel mill.

Entry.JapaneseText: それにガップラは、この溶鉱炉に 向かうところを目撃された後から、 消息がわからなくなっている。
Entry.EnglishText: Besides, Gapra has been missing since he was last seen heading to this blast furnace.

Entry.JapaneseText: おまけにココですすり泣くような声や 物音を聞いたって騒ぎまであるし まったく、ワケわかんねーよ。
Entry.EnglishText: In addition to that, there's even a commotion about hearin' voices and sobbing in here.

Entry.JapaneseText: ま、まずは、このくぼみの秘密を 突き止めるのが先決ですね！
Entry.EnglishText: W-well, first thing's first, what we need to do is figure out the secret of the hollow space!

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、そうすれば この怪事件の真相が 見えるかもしれないな。
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah, maybe we can finally get to the bottom of this.

Entry.JapaneseText: ひょっとして、おまえたち、 何かわかったのか？
Entry.EnglishText: By any chance, did you guys find out anything?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……どうだろうな。 俺たちもガップラと同じ事をすれば 答えはでるはずだ……
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder, Maybe if we do what Gapra did, we might have our answer...

Entry.JapaneseText: 行くぞ、アニー。
Entry.EnglishText: Let's go, <Annie>.

Entry.JapaneseText: はい。
Entry.EnglishText: Right.

Entry.JapaneseText: おい、<Veigue>、<Annie>！ 何がわかったのか 教えてくれよぉー。
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, <Veigue>,<Annie>! What'd ya figure out? Let me in on it too!

Entry.JapaneseText: これで事の真相がわかるはずだ。
Entry.EnglishText: This should help us get to the bottom of things.

Entry.JapaneseText: アニー、ひょっとして怖いのか？
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>, could it be... Are you scared?

Entry.JapaneseText: そ、そんなことありません！ ちょっと緊張してるだけです……
Entry.EnglishText: N-no, I'm not! I'm just a little nervous...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>くぼみにブローチをはめますか？ はめる はめない
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>Do you want to fit the brooch in the hollow space? Fit it Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: うおっ！ 壁が動きやがった。
Entry.EnglishText: Whoa! The wall moved.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……いくぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Let's go.

Entry.JapaneseText: おう！
Entry.EnglishText: Onward!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……はい。
Entry.EnglishText: Sure...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『壁のくぼみ』 何かをかたどったような形をした くぼみがある。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0> "Hollow in the Wall" There is a dimple in the wall that seems to take a specific shape of something.
